greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of factorizations of n into factors > 1 not including any prime powers.
comment: Also the number of multiset partitions of the multiset of prime indices of n with no constant parts.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20160
Antti Karttunen, Data supplement: n, a(n) computed for n = 1..100000
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
program: (PARI) A322452(n, m=n) = if(1==n, 1, my(s=0); fordiv(n, d, if((d>1)&&(d<=m)&&(1<omega(d)), s += A322452(n/d, d))); (s)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 03 2019

(PARI) first(n) = my(res=vector(n)); for(i=1, n, f=factor(i); v=vecsort(f[,2] , , 4); f[, 2] = v; fb = factorback(f); if(fb==i, res[i] = A322452(i), res[i] = res[fb])); res \\ A322452 the function above \\ _David A. Corneth_, Jan 03 2019
xref: Positions of 0's are the prime powers A000961.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 09 2018
